Posts.Content: Hi Wendy d, i haven't had a MX but did have 2 WLE , because of an allergic reaction to the first post op dressing my surgeon used a glue dressing .With the glue dressing I could shower quite quickly after surgery - sorry can't remember when, I think Chemo brain has kicked in but I am sure someone on this amazing site will have the answer. Hope everything goes well, take care. Xx
Posts.Title: Personal freshness.

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee congratulations and well done . At the moment I am struggling with exercising so thank you for shining some sparkle on a rather miserable day. Hopefully after my tanning sessions I will get back to the Gym and maybe next year I will be running too. xx
Posts.Title: 10k Great Scottish Run

Posts.Content: Hi Dawn I have been wondering how things were going.  I am positive everything will go well for you today.  Keep well and be kind to yourself. Sending you love and luck xx
Posts.Title: hooray hooray....starting EC chemo today!!

Posts.Content: Hi Kay Like you I had two surgeries and I am left with what some people may regard as an ugly scar and if I am honest at first that is what I also thought. I now look in the mirror and see a new me - someone who is not perfect but then I never was perfect before BC. I had a 3.2 cm lump and the nipple removed from my left breast and then of course the surgeon had to go back for more to achieve clear margins. I haven't been swimming yet due to the rest of my treatment so I can't honestly say how I will feel when I can return to the pool but like Robs I have worn strappy tops to try to keep cool during this lovely weather we have been having. I understand your reluctance to return to the pool but I am sure that you will when you feel ready, I found that most people are lucky to give you a passing glance but if they do stare- shame on them. With a little time I hope those feelings of shame/ embarrassment fade along with the scar. Dreamthief told me not to look in the mirror and see a victim but a cancer kicking warrior and that's what we all intend to do. Take care, enjoy spending time with your children. Love and hugs xx
Posts.Title: Ashamed/Embarrassed by scar.......

Posts.Content: Hi Jane  I was advised to use baby shampoo and Vitamin E oil to help look after my scalp and it worked for me, my scalp was never dry during treatment.  I believe no question is trivial iwhile on this path. Mandy x
Posts.Title: scalp

Posts.Content: Thanks JuJu as I am just having EC I will ask the question on Monday. I too am drinking lots of more water than I possibly did last session and I am also cutting back on my work schedule to see if that helps. Hope you have good results next time. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Help need some advice re: L iver Function test results

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I had my 5th session yesterday and thanks to the steroids and my lovely other half snoring I am in the wide awake club. I know I should be happy that I am near the end of this part of my treatment but I think I am starting to feel anxious and I am finding it difficult to explain to family and friends. Yes I have been lucky with having minimal SE etc. and I am closer to the end but it feels almost like I am losing my security blanket. Does that seem irrational ? I am sat on the couch with my beautiful German Shepherd and although she is a good listener she doesn't have much to say in reply other than trying to give me kisses. I think I am concentrating in getting from one appointment to the next focussing on the task and not looking at the emotional side of treatment but I have had a mini melt-down this week, Monday should have been my mums 74th birthday and I just can't believe I lost her 6. Months ago and on Tuesday my friend had her diagnosis confirmed and has joined the BC club. I think I am worried that I am feeling down and if I do go down I may not get back up, maybe I feel this way because it's the middle of the night and our minds play tricks with us or maybe it's because I am fed-up being " brave" as so many friends and family tell me. I am grateful for all their love and support and I don't mean to sound like a moaning Minnie but sometimes I just want to howl at the moon...... Sorry rant over. thank you for reading. Sending love to everyone xx
Posts.Title: 5th Chemo done 1 more to go , should be happy .....but

Posts.Content: Hi G & J and Moll thank you for the link. You are right it is a very good read. I think I just found these last few days overwhelming but I am sure I will return to my " normal" self in a few days. I am sure it will help. Thank you once again xx
Posts.Title: 5th Chemo done 1 more to go , should be happy .....but

Posts.Content: Hi Nicola, thank you . Sorry your treatment has been delayed there are so many colds going around at the moment,hope you get over yours soon. My dogs name is Belle and she really is beautiful plus her snoring is not as loud as the other halfs. Take care, lots of love xx
Posts.Title: 5th Chemo done 1 more to go , should be happy .....but

Posts.Content: Thanks Emma I think you sisters motto is apt but I think I will try howling at the moon tonight but I don't think Belle will join me she will probably run and hide with embarrassment at her mum the nut job (she is our baby , my other half and I dont have children together but he is a fantastic step-dad to my two grown-up children) thank you again for your kind words it really makes a difference. take care xx
Posts.Title: 5th Chemo done 1 more to go , should be happy .....but

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I met with Onc today before my 3rd round of EC she mentioned Liver Function Results but because I was on my own and my brain is not at its optimum I can't remember exactly what was said. I did have my chemo today but she said if the results were not improved next time she will reduce my Chemo. Just wondered if this is sometimes a normal SE as my Onc said it was nothing for me to worry abouti. This really is a rollercoaster ride as I woke up this morning after having over 7hrs sleep for the first time in weeks feeling fantastic and now well not too sure how I am feeling. Is there anything I could be doing ? Has anyone taken Milk Thistle ? I have been told this can help with Liver Function but obviously not going to try anything without running it past Onc. Thank you for any advice or suggestions xx
Posts.Title: Help need some advice re: L iver Function test results

Posts.Content: Thanks G & J for the reply, I just needed some reassurance , my Onc did say she would probably reduce my next session if the results are the same but as I said I was on my own and couldn't really remember everything that was said. I have looked at the research on Milk Thistle but I won't try anything without checking first. Hope you are both well and again thank you xx
Posts.Title: Help need some advice re: L iver Function test results

Posts.Content: Hi Penny, I asked my Oncologist on Wednesday if and when to have the flu jab. She advised me to wait for 4 weeks after my final Chemo, she did give me a proper explanation but courtesy of Chemo brain I can't remember the reason so sorry it's not sane advice. Remember to polish yourself in anti- bac gel to keep those germs at bay xx
Posts.Title: Disappointed :(

Posts.Content: Hi Katie thank you. The wide awake thing really plays havoc with your mind sometimes. I know what you are saying about having a break for Xmas if things stay on track I should be finished my rads on the 3rd of December so just in time to have a different Xmas day, the kids and I are planning to spend the day in our onesies ( classy) but that is what they would like , just a day eating and watching Xmas TV . I will be thinking of you on the 21st , keep well and thanks xx
Posts.Title: 5th Chemo done 1 more to go , should be happy .....but

Posts.Content: Hi I had the rest of my hair shaved yesterday and like you my scalp is a bit sensitive. I am assuming the stubble will fall out as I am also still shedding and I did have some bald patches. I was advised to continue to use Baby Shampoo on my scalp and also Vitamin E oil to help with dry skin . I know what you mean about the runny nose I have tissues in every pocket. I am sure someone will come along with an answer for when hair grows back etc,I would like to know the answer as well. Take care xx
Posts.Title: jaggy stubble

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa Baby shampoo and vitamin e oil as recommended by the wig maker. E45 cream , Dulcolax and Bonjela. Hopefully you won't need everything on your list but best to be prepared. Sending love and luck xx
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Hi Mel I don't know if it is the same in your area I was given a NHS wig voucher at the unit I am being treated. The wig is amazing just like my hair prior to diagnosis. I also looked at just having a fringe for when I was wearing a Bandana if you want to take a look at Heathers Hair. I too wonder about colour and texture, I met a lovely lady a few months ago whose hair crew back silver and curly and in fab condition much better than before . Take care xx
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Morning Shaz that's really fantastic news xx
Posts.Title: Great News

Posts.Content: Hi G & J how I wish we had a like button on here. Thank you for brightening up my day. x
Posts.Title: Did anyone else develop a teensy consultant crush during their treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi Willow so sorry your recent experiences have not been great. Last year my Mum received fantastic care from the Beatson for herRads and also the Oncolgy Unit at Ayr Hospital. This year I have had some amazing treatment and support from the team here in the North East of England - three different hospitals with the continuity in my wonderful BCN . I have found everyone I have came into contact so far amazing, someone said that to work in Oncology the staff must be sprinkled with angel dust and so far based on my own personal experiences I have to agree.. I hope the rest of your treatment goes smoothly. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Not so great experiences with NHS - good news stories please!

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda I live 9 miles from Durham, where are you?
Posts.Title: Not so great experiences with NHS - good news stories please!

Posts.Content: Sorry I meant Misty Moley typing on the iPad which is never good. Xx
Posts.Title: Help - Results today

Posts.Content: Hi Murphy I was in the same position at the end of June, I am also Grade 3 , er+ , her2-. I asked my Onc what she would advise if I was her sister and the answer was Chemo that was good enough for me but she gave my O/H the stats and he agreed it was the right decision for me. We are all different and Chemo affects us all in different ways but I am over half way through Chemo and as others have said it is doable. For me it's knowing that I have tried everything to prevent a recurrence. I hope I have helped but whatever decision you make it will be the right one for you. Sending you love and luck xx
Posts.Title: Help - Results today

Posts.Content: Hi Murphy mine was 32mm. I understand about the sickness thing as I can be sick if I cough too much ( it's a panic thing) but I have to say so far I have never been sick with Chemo I have felt a bit sickly once or twice and ate a few Ginger Biscuits which worked wonders. As Misty motley says they are really good at giving you the right pills to prevent the sickness. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Help - Results today

Posts.Content: Hi Katharine congrats on having last session, I have one more to go but also feel like I am losing my security blanket. I was told that the Tamoxifen will start after rads finish. I have my last session on the 22nd of October and my rads are due to start on the 13th of November so should be finished by the 3rd or 4th of December so just a 3 week wait, sorry I don't know if the timescale varies from region to region . Hope this helps , take care xx
Posts.Title: after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I have just started Radiotherapy so haven't experienced anything as yet but I do seem to have a dry mouth but I was putting that down to nerves as I am a bit claustrophobic and I don't like anything near my face and of course part of the machine is quite close to my face. Hope your cough eases and you get a good nights sleep. xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy ,dry throat and cough

Posts.Content: Hi Joanne You do not have to apologise for the way you are feeling and you certainly do not sound desperate. I had the same op as you on the 19th of May , the area under my arm was also numb so I think that is quite normal. I think the waiting for the results for me was possibly the hardest as you just want the answers which allows you to move on to the next step . We all find different ways to cope with the wait , for me I went back to work to give me something else to focus on and also started reading books that I have promised myself I would read but never found the time before , when my mum was diagnosed she took up knitting which she said helped her immensely as she had to concentrate on the patterns so hopefully you can find something which helps you. Xx
Posts.Title: Sleepless nights

Posts.Content: Good luck for Tuesday, I took my little blanket that i use on holiday flights as even though it was during the hot spell we had in July my arm did become a little cold also the advice of drink plenty of water really does make a difference.Take care xx
Posts.Title: treatment starts Tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn I am also on EC, I had my 4th session last week it appears that my hair is starting to grow I have a very fine covering new hair so fingers crossed I keep it and may be rocking the Sinead O' Connor look again by Christmas or maybe a Brillo pad if it comes back curly lol xx
Posts.Title: Hair Re-growth

Posts.Content: Hi Penny, sorry to hear you are feeling so low at the moment. Just wanted to share a couple of things that I have found to work for me. Firstly the painful scalp, Dorothee is right I had a Grade 1 and almost instantly the pain disappeared. Secondly the mouth ulcers I used a bicarbonate of soda mouthwash which helped until I asked Onc for Difflam and Gelcllair which someone else had recommended on this site and this session only had one tiny ulcer on the tip of my tongue . The last piece of advice was given to me by my Great Uncle Bill - the more you greet ( cry) the less you pee, based on that piece of logic the night time trips to the loo should be less frequent thus aiding a good nights sleep. I know you are usually always upbeat in all our conversations but please feel free to moan anytime, keep well xx
Posts.Title: Sore mouth,sore scalp, sorely in need of advice, please!

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone Sorry if this seems like a silly question. I was diagnosed with BC on April 24th and had a WLE on the 19th of May just waiting to find out the next stage of my treatment. I have been advised that Chemo may be next ,followed by Radiotherapy and then drug therapy,my cancer is aggressive as well as er+ I lost my Mum ( lung cancer)4 weeks prior to my diagnosis and as we all know Mum is your best friend who offers love support and advice. Mum handled all her treatment with great courage and strength and I only hope and pray I am half as brave as she was. But losing her means I don't have anyone to ask this question. I am not anxious or worried about the path I am about to take or the effects of the treatment , everyone else around me seems to have these worries and look at me as if I am mad for being calm and matter of fact on what may come next. That's why I am asking the question is this normal? Thank you for reading . Sending love and luck to everyone on this journey. Mandy x
Posts.Title: Is how I am feeling normal?

Posts.Content: Good Morning George & Jackie Thank you for responding. It feels like you get me. It was difficult so soon after Mum but there is never a good time. I think I have a good understanding of what may come and that is possibly why I don't have that many fears but I do have some. I have an appointment with my consultant on Thursday so will find out then re: her2 status , have found good advice on this site about Herceptin . I now follow the rules as at first I couldn't help googling my diagnosis but I scared the c!!p out of myself so made the decision to look on BCC site and this one. It truly is a real community of support, advice , positivity and love. Take care
Posts.Title: Is how I am feeling normal?

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone Firstly I would like to apologise for not replying sooner. I have had family staying and I don't seem to have had a minute to myself. Secondly I would like to thank you for your kind words and support. Bongo 56 (Alison) l understand the reason for not tell your Mum as like you I didn't tell my Mum that I had found a lump and was worried as she was fighting her own battle and I didn't want to add to her worries but I believe she has been with me every step of the way so far. I will take your advice and look for a group in my area. Thank you Mb77 ( Marianne) I was sorry to hear about your Dad . You are right about experiencing cancer and the treatment making me more grounded as normally I am one of life's worriers but as you say it home life continues as normal, luckily I don't have to do the school run as my kids are all grown but the dog still needs feeding and the washing etc. thank you GillieB I have got my courage and strength from Mum as I think have you and as I continue on this path I know she will continue to do so. You are right about it being harder for everyone around us I think my sister is finding it more difficult and is stressing over everything no matter how hard I try to reassure her( I am the older sister by a year). Thank you Trudi E I was also very emotional reading your post. I am sorry to hear of your loss and the lack of support from your mum. I was encouraged by your decision to cut off your hair as this is what I think I will also do. I believe every woman is beautiful with or without hair or makeup. Thank you Lastly I apologise for the long post . Sending you all love and luck xx
Posts.Title: Is how I am feeling normal?

Posts.Content: Hi Dawn , thank you SE are side effects and so far so good not to many complaints. Chocolate birthday cake is always a bonus. I was thinking of you yesterday and hoped that you would be in touch. It really wasn't too bad yesterday I was only on the unit for an hour and forty but I got to chat to the other girls , two of them were on their last treatment and both were kind and encouraging and very supportive. ( it was so quick as I was first on the unit 9 o' clock and am only having EC chemo) please let me know how you are getting on, when is your scan scheduled? Sending you love and luck xx
Posts.Title: First Chemo over

Posts.Content: Thank you Vicki, the waiting is hard but it will soon be here. This forum is fantastic for advice , tips and support and I am finding it invaluable, I read a lot of the posts in order to prepare myself for yesterday and obviously following the advice of my Chemo Nurse. Please let me know how you get on. Take care xx
Posts.Title: First Chemo over

Posts.Content: Good Morning I had my first chemo session yesterday everything went smoothly, so far I have limited SE - a little tired and a touch of heartburn which didn't stop me from enjoying a large slice of my sons birthday cake. The only other thing I experienced was after only 3 hours sleep I was in the wide awake club I am assuming that is an effect of steroids? Thank you so much to everyone who reassured me when I had a bit of a wobble, I was anxious about the effects of chemo so wanted to share my experience in the hope that it could help reassure anyone just about to start their Chemo. Sending everyone love and luck xx
Posts.Title: First Chemo over

Posts.Content: Hi Daft Bird I found myself on the couch along with the dog whose snoring is only slighter quieter than the O/H. My Chemo Nurse has instructed me to take the steroids at midday from today so hopefully that will help. Here's to a good nights sleep xx
Posts.Title: First Chemo over

Posts.Content: Thanks Alison I know what you mean about your iPad , my brother installed Sky Go onto my iPad for me so that came in handy this morning. I love Candy crush already addicted. I will take the steroid a bit earlier today. I was given Ondansetron tablets . My son has came home for a few days to so I am being spoiled, cooking breakfast etc Hope the sun is shining where you are. xx
Posts.Title: First Chemo over

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa I have bought some amazing bandanas and scarves and sleep caps from annabanda. They are really reasonably priced and the service has been fantastic. I also thought about ordering a fringe from another site called Heathers Hair, they provide real hair weaves all that they ask is you cover the cost of postage and perhaps if you are able to make a donation. I haven't done this but I have heard of others who have and have been really pleased. At the moment according to the family I am rocking the Sinead O' Connor / Annie Lennox look but I may change my mind when I have no hair. I also have a fab wig but just find it too hot at the moment.have fun shopping. Sending you love and luck xx
Posts.Title: hats and scarves ?

Posts.Content: Good Morning Everyone, it's my last tanning session today and am unsure if I am awake this early because of nerves or excitement. I just wanted to send luck and love to everyone who has gone through, is going through or just about to start treatment. xx
Posts.Title: Last Radiotherapy today.
